comment._content: Great to hear that you're enjoying them, thanks for your message. There's lots more where these came from! Check out our online catalogue: catalogue.nli.ie/

comment.author: 36844288@N00
comment._content:
Yes, some wonderful images - thank you!
I have to say - I do like the timber 'Chinaman' on the premises on the right - does anyone know if that is what it was and why it was there? I'm guessing it is a shop or pub sign?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Well spotted! Yes, this statue advertises The Chinaman Bar & Lounge. It's of the Captain of a Chinese ship who donated money to the town’s people for helping him fight off pirates.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
